Package: org.ysb33r.groovy.dsl.vfs.impl

[Groovy] Class CopyMoveOperations

    • org.ysb33r.groovy.dsl.vfs.impl.CopyMoveOperations

      • Properties Summary

          Properties 
          Type Name and description
          static groovy.lang.Closure  ONLY_NEWER
          An overwrite policy that will only overwrite when the source is newer than the destination.

      • Property Detail

        • static final groovy.lang.Closure ONLY_NEWER

          An overwrite policy that will only overwrite when the source is newer than the destination. If either scheme of of the source or the destination does not support Capability.GET_LAST_MODIFIED, then overwrite will be sanctioned.

      • Method Detail

        • @groovy.transform.CompileStatic static java.lang.Object copy(FileObject from, FileObject to, boolean smash, java.lang.Object overwrite, boolean recursive, java.lang.Object filter = null )

          Returns:
          Parameters:
          from
          to
          smash
          overwrite - 'true', 'false' or a Closure which will be passed a fileObject and must return groovy truth
          filter - Optional filter to apply. If the from type is a file, then the filter is ignored.

        • @groovy.transform.CompileStatic static java.lang.Object friendlyURI(FileObject uri)

        • @groovy.transform.CompileStatic static java.lang.Object move(FileObject from, FileObject to, boolean smash, java.lang.Object overwrite, boolean intermediates = true, boolean noCreateSubFolder = false)

          Returns:
          Parameters:
          from
          to
          smash - - Ability to forcefully replace a file with a folder and vice-versa
          overwrite
          intermediates - Default behaviour is to create intermediate subdirectories of target path, should they not exist. Set to 'false' if this behaviour is not desired
          noCreateSubFolder - In most cases when moving a folder into a folder then target subfolder needs to be created. There are some cases where this behaviour is deemed inappropriate. In those cases set to true.
